newsitem.title: NORWAY: NorWegian shares flat, but Nera plunges.
newsitem.headline: NorWegian shares flat, but Nera plunges.

text.p: Norway's all-share index was flat in lacklustre trade on Thursday but telecommunications group Nera tumbled on exaggerated profit forecasts.
Oslo's Total index closed 0.07 percent higher at 1,071.88 points in light turnover of 777 million crowns.
Volume was inflated earlier this week by heavy trade in banks engaged in takeover battles, including Fokus Bank which finished 0.7 percent off at 72.50 crowns.
Nera was the most traded share at 88 million crowns and closed 9.0 percent lower at 323 crowns after slipping throughout the session amid talk of first-quarter profits due next week.
The share fell further after Nera said it expected results to be roughly in line with the result of the year-ago period, when Nera booked a pre-tax profit of 26.6 million crowns.
"Market consensus was for a pre-tax profit of around 50 million crowns, but it turns out it will be roughly half of that," the dealer said.
The outlook was uncertain given U.S. interest rate trends.
"Sit on cyclical shares, oil shares, and some shipping stock. Be careful with shares that have high p/e ratios. They are in general sensitive to interest-rate changes," he said.
